text: HRy <7zty RTTHNif qifeerut 7419 Phone 91.11-25074100/25074200 (r& Yar 3k TtHrf 4ra4) Thc9 / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) ~-5 & 6_ da27-10 , ERdT, T Rorit-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No.11041/218/2007-Admn Dated: 08.03.2016 PQLCY MAIERS-TechnicaL (202/2016) Decision_taken on File_NoRSC 5017412120152 Sub: Implementation of Road Satety Action Plan for NHAI While accepting the report submitted by the committee headed by Sh.A.V.Sinha, DG(RD)&Ss (Reta) on Strengthening Re-organization of Road Safety Cell (RSC) of NHAI" vide Agenda item no 271.01 on 04.02.2016,Executive Committee headed by Chairman, NHAI has finalised following short term and long term action plan for road safety by RSC: As Shott Term Action Plan (upto 31.3.2017) (i) Engagement of a team of Road Safety Expert at NHAI(HQ) for capacity building: (i_) Procurement and contract management of Road  Safety activities and ensuring compliance of their observations pertaining to safety: (ii)   Preparation of a checklist on safety issues for compliance by the technical divisions, PDs, ROs required  during project preparation, procurement and during execution of the projects. (iv) Evaluation of contractual clausesl provisions under applicable manuals/schedules of the contract pertaining to road safety. (v) Independent identification /validation of blackspots on different sections of GQ including finalization of the proposals for their rectification; (i/c Compilation of short term/immediate measure (vi) Commissioning of 5 pilot projects on ITS model with the latest IT based safety applications (vii) Preparation of the draft standard operating procedure(SOPlfor management of accidents after having discussion with other stakeholders like concessionaire, State police, health official and other agencies. (viii) Standard Operating Procedure for different divisions required for project report preparation and implementation from safety angle: (ix) Formalization of a policy and content to improve the pUblic awareness for the electric and print media (x) Identification of requirement for training of all officials for safety related issues. (xi)  Coordination and finalization of  engineering solutions for all black spots identified by the MORTH while following protocol procedure with the help of technical division and field units. (xii) Formulation of policy for private participation in the road safety activities like FOB, patrolling etc: (xiii) Formulation of a policy to handle removal of deficiencies in the on -going works including independent road safety audits in about 1O00 km sections  MaI NHAI
